name: scutellaria galericulata
description:
New! Scutellaria galericulata, Marsh Skullcap, is a perennial
that grows to about 2 feet in height and displays delicate purple to blue
blooms from June to August. The lateral stem holds alternating pairs of leaves
where the flowers form. As the name suggest this species prefers wetter soils
under full to partial sun.  Marsh
Skullcap has been used as an ornamental plant for years and in medicine to
treat various nervous disorders. There are over 200 different species of
Skullcap in the world and here at Prairie Moon we carry; Mad-dog Skullcap,
Hoary Skullcap, Heart-leaved, and Small Skullcap.
